qas.question: The Third Street Promenade is located in what part of Santa Monica?
How large is the Third Street Promenade?
What is Third Street access shut off from?
What two major department stores are located at the Third Street Promenade?
What year did the mall reopen?
In what year was Third Street closed to vehicles?
In what year did Nordstrom open its store?
What's at the north end of the Promenade?

context: The <a0_0>Downtown District<a0_0/> is the home of the Third Street Promenade, a major outdoor pedestrian-only shopping district that stretches for <a1_0><b5_0><b9_0>three blocks<b9_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> between Wilshire Blvd. and Broadway (not the same Broadway in downtown and south Los Angeles). Third Street is closed to <a2_0>vehicles<a2_0/> for those three blocks to allow people to stroll, congregate, shop and enjoy street performers. Santa Monica Place, featuring <a3_0><b8_0>Bloomingdale's<b8_0/> and Nordstrom<a3_0/> in a three-level outdoor environment, is located at the south end of the Promenade. After a period of redevelopment, the mall reopened in the fall of <a4_0><b6_0><b7_0>2010<b7_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/> as a modern shopping, entertainment and dining complex with more outdoor space.
